markdownRemark.html:
Liftover is a common action to deal with genomic result generated from different verison of reference. VCF files are generated from reference-mapped BAM file, thus they are influence as well. I googled a bit, one solution I can use is Picard.

I downloaded the latest version of Picard from here into current folder.

Then the code is:

java -jar picard.jar LiftoverVcf \
     I=../S02_DownloadOldVCFs/OldVCFs/uk35C650/FR07961001.pass.recode.vcf.gz \
     O=./Lifted/uk35C650_LiftOver.vcf \
     CHAIN=b37ToHg38.over.chain \
     REJECT=./Lifted/uk35C650_rejected_variants.vcf \
     R=./Homo_sapiens_assembly38.fasta

Among them, I and O are input and output.

  • CHAIN represent liftover chain file, in my case, I am lifting over from hg37 to hg38, thus I download file from here. I am not 100% sure this is the best link, I found similar access from UCSC hgTable.

  • REJECT represent a vcf file to save vcf record can't be lifted. This is MUST parameter, any point to a random file would work.

  • R means the new target reference you are lifting for. In my case, I want to lift it to hg38, thus I am using a hg38 reference as target reference. Note that this can't be zipped file.

Below is the final results in Lifted folder:

Finally, I follow this post for VCF file lifting.

frontmatter.title: Liftover VCF from hg37 to hg38 with Picard
frontmatter.abstract: In my recent task, I need to compare a set of VCF generated from hg37, with another set of VCF generated from hg38. Thus, I need to liftover those hg37-version VCF to hg38. The solution I found is using Picard.
